attributes.action: Help fund medical degrees and implement more medical awareness in education
attributes.additional_details:
The NHS waiting list is dangerously crowded, there are too many patients and not enough doctors - so we must encourage more people to become doctors, and financially support even our current medical students.

Additionally, UK residents must learn how to treat minor medical emergencies independently, as to not take up room in the limited A&E's available. Compulsory education could implement this, so that households are equipped with medical knowledge they can apply.
attributes.background: More financial support towards medical degrees (i.e sponsoring first year), and training students in compulsory education with how to treat minor medical emergencies: CPR, bruises, and cuts.

rejection.details:
You can already get help with your study and living costs if you're studying to be a doctor or dentist: https://www.gov.uk/nhs-bursaries

We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Scrap student fees for nursing, midwifery and paramedic students: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/654336

Basic first aid, including basic treatment for common injuries
and life-saving skills, including how to administer CPR, is already part of the national curriculum: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/relationships-education-relationships-and-sex-education-rse-and-health-education/physical-health-and-mental-wellbeing-primary-and-secondary
